Problem:
Consider a system where the output, \\( z(t) \\), is derived from the input, \\( x(t) \\), via a complex function and an integral transformation defined by \\( z(t) = \\int_0^t e^{A(t-\\tau)}Bx(\\tau) d\\tau \\), where A and B are matrices and \\( e^{At} \\) denotes the matrix exponential.

If the input \\( x(t) \\) changes in a predictable manner over time without any intervention, will this result in a predictable and proportional change in \\( z(T) \\) at a fixed time T?
Explanation: Since \\( z(t) \\) is directly affected by \\( x(t) \\) through a continuous and time-invariant transformation, any predictable change in \\( x(t) \\) will induce a corresponding and computable change in \\( z(T) \\), following the characteristics of the linear transformation system. The time-invariance and linearity of the transformation ensure this proportionality.
